title: Starmer acted for extremist Islamist group in bid to overturn ban
description: Sir Keir Starmer acted on behalf of an extremist Islamist group seeking to overturn a ban imposed on its activities in Germany, The Sunday Telegraph can disclose. The Labour leader led a team of lawyers claiming that Berlin’s prohibition of Hizb ut-Tahrir breached the group’s rights to freedom of religion and expression.

title: UK and Germany push for 'sustainable ceasefire' in Gaza
description: Germany and the UK have called for a “sustainable ceasefire” in Gaza that can be a step towards a two-state future developed with Arab help. title: Stubbing her toe was first sign of Gateshead gran's heartbreaking brain tumour
description: Carol Tate died a year after innocuously stubbing her toe proved the first sign of a brain tumour. Stubbing her toe while on a hike was the first sign of a fatal cancer that would kill a Sunniside grandmother.

title: Former South Africa president Jacob Zuma leaves ANC
description: Former South African president Jacob Zuma says he will not vote for the African National Congress (ANC) and is creating a new political party. Mr Zuma was the country's president between 2009 and 2018. He said it "would be a betrayal" to campaign for the ANC of current President Cyril Ramaphosa.

title: Rob Gronkowski to sing national anthem at LA Bowl as he misses FOX TV coverage

title: Kuwait ruler Sheikh Nawaf dies at 86 after weeks in hospital
description: Sheikh Nawaf Al Ahmad Al Sabah, Kuwait’s ruling emir, has died aged 86 after a three-year reign. Kuwait state television broke into programming with Quranic verses just before a sombre official made the announcement.

title: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says ‘much more’ needed from Government on NI funding model

title: Translink: NI buses and trains cancelled for third day
description: Businesses and shoppers across Northern Ireland are facing a day of disruption as bus and train staff strike over pay. It is the second consecutive day of industrial action by Translink staff and the third walk out this month. Union leaders said members had no alternative but to strike due to attempts to "instigate a pay freeze".

title: Sebastian Murphy-Bates
